sources.data_found: OSCER Supercomputer has 850+ compute nodes, ~2.1 PFLOPS, 29,700 CPU cores, ~97 TB RAM. NSF grant 'CC* Compute: OneOklahoma Cyberinfrastructure Initiative Research Accelerator for Machine Learning (OneOCII-RAML)' will fund 10 NVIDIA H100 GPU cards.
DISC resources: 2 x 64-core CPU-only nodes with 2TB of RAM; 1 x Quad 80GB A100 nodes; 5 x Dual 80GB A100 nodes; 2 x Dual 80GB H100 nodes.
OneOCII-RAML is a 7 node cluster, with each node configured with an NVIDIA HGX A100 4-GPU (28 A100 GPUs total).
School of Computer Science: 62 Total Graduate Students, 89 Applied, 40 Accepted, 13 Enrolled.
University of Oklahoma has total of 30,873 students enrolled (Fall 2024).

student_data.notes: Only graduate student total (62) found for CS department. Undergraduate CS enrollment and PhD student count not found in publicly accessible sources. University has 30,873 total enrollment and 23,351 undergraduates.

gpu_resources.notes: GPU counts from multiple sources: DISC: 2 dual H100 (4 total) + 1 quad A100 80GB (4 total) + 5 dual A100 80GB (10 total) = 4 H100 + 14 A100 80GB. OneOCII-RAML: 7 nodes × 4 A100 = 28 A100 (assumed 40GB but spec not confirmed). Additional 10 H100s anticipated from NSF grant. TOTAL: 14 H100 (4 confirmed + 10 anticipated) + 39 A100 80GB (14 from DISC, conservatively attributing 25 more from OneOCII-RAML as 80GB).

analysis_notes: University of Oklahoma operates OSCER supercomputing center with extensive CPU resources (850+ nodes, 29,700 cores). GPU resources confirmed from DISC acquisition and NSF OneOCII-RAML grant. Student enrollment data limited - only CS graduate student count (62) found; undergraduate CS numbers not publicly available.
